Description: Limestone figure of a bound prisoner, of the same type as EA 23825. The body of this example has been better modelled and is shown with a rounded belly and heavy thighs. The bound arms and legs behind the figure are schematically rendered as a ridge along the edge of the piece; on one side this is partly broken. The headdress has a high central ridge.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Found to the east of the "Qasr" annex, beyond Petrie's chamber 29
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 10, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53. This is one of a group of about 30 to 40 similar figures, all found together, of which 5 others are London, BM, EA 23825, 23826, 23828 to 23830). See also Oxford, AM, 1887.2496-2497 (2 items); Boston, MFA, 87.810-814 (= RES.87.121-125; 5 items altogether); Liverpool, 3.2.87.8; Bristol, H 1987, H1132 (?)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 10, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.57, p.178, pl.20)
